meanings.definition: An advance showing or performance of something, such as a movie or play, before it is released or shown to the public.
meanings.sent1: I got tickets to the movie preview next week.
meanings.sent2: The audience was excited to watch the preview of the new play.
meanings.sent3: At the preview, the actors kept forgetting their lines, making it a comedy.
meanings.sent4: The preview of the film was like a sneak peek into the world of magic.
meanings.sent5: The preview of the concert made me eager to experience the full show.

meanings.definition: To view or inspect something before it is officially released or shown.
meanings.sent1: I will preview the document before sending it out.
meanings.sent2: She likes to preview the clothes online before going to the store.
meanings.sent3: He decided to preview the cake before the party to make sure it was perfect.
meanings.sent4: Previewing the new car made him dream of driving it on the open road.
meanings.sent5: They always preview the software to catch any errors before launch.

meanings.definition: A brief summary or overview of something that is to come.
meanings.sent1: The preview of the next episode hinted at a big surprise.
meanings.sent2: She gave a quick preview of the main points in her presentation.
meanings.sent3: The preview of the book left out all the exciting parts, making it boring.
meanings.sent4: The preview of the game was like a teaser for the thrilling adventure ahead.
meanings.sent5: The preview of the event made everyone eager to attend and see what's in store.
